data.title: Las Vegas Golf Academy,Las Vegas Golf School,School of Golf Las Vegas
data.text:
1999 British Masters Champion and tied for 1st at the 2000 PGA Championship "Turn up the volume"

Bob May - British Masters 1st Place

Amateur Career of Bob May

1982 American Junior Golf Association Lakewood Country Club LA 1st PLACE

1982 American Junior Golf Association Innisbrook, Florida 1st PLACE

1982 American Junior Golf Association Mission Hills, Rancho Mirage 2nd PLACE

1983 American Junior Golf Associati on Six Flags Texas 1st PLACE

1983 Junior Golf World San Diego, CA 4th PLACE

1984 American Jr. Golf Association Edgewood C. C. Lake Tahoe, CA 1st PLACE

1984 Doug Sanders International Championship - Texas 2nd PLACE

1984 American Jr. Golf Association Tournament of Champions - GA. 1st PLACE

1984 Low Amateur (Medalist) for the L.A. Open Hillcrest C.C. shot (67)

1984 Sports Illustrated Player of the Year

1984 Junior World Golf - San Diego 3rd PLACE

1984 Youngest Qualifier for the U.S. Amateur 15 years old

1984 American Junior Golf Association First Team All American

1984 Southern California Championship 1st PLACE

1984 American Jr. Golf Association Future Legends Onion Creek,TX 2nd PLACE

1985 American Junior Golf Association Woodlands,Texas 1st PLACE

1985 American Junior Golf Association Mission Hills Country Club 1st PLACE

1985 Doug Sanders International Championship - Texas 1st PLACE

1985 Doug Sanders International Championship - Scotland 3rd PLACE

1985 California State High School Championship 2nd PLACE

1985 American Junior Golf Association First Team All American

1984, 85 PGA Player of the year

1984, 85, 86, 87 M.V.P. High School and All-City League

1984 California Interscholastic Federation 2nd PLACE

1985 California Interscholastic Federation 2nd PLACE

1986 California Interscholastic Federation 1st PLACE

1987 California Interscholastic Federation 2nd PLACE

1986 American Jr. Golf Association Edgewood C. C. Lake Tahoe, CA 1st PLACE

1987 American Jr. Golf Association Edgeood C.C. (course record 66)1st PLACE

1986 Low Amateur for U.S. Open Sectional Qualifying - San Francisco

1986 Runner Up Amateur Qualifier San Diego Open youngest player 2nd PLACE

1987 California State Amateur Championship 2nd PLACE

1987 U.S. Amateur Qualifier

1988 California State Low Amateur 1st PLACE

1988 NCAA All American

1988 Broadmoor Invitational Semi-Finalist

1988 Morris Williams College Tournament - Texas 1st PLACE

1988 California State Open Low Amateur 1st PLACE

1989 Qualified U.S. Amateur

1989 Porter Cup - Niagara Falls Country Club 5th PLACE

1989 Western Amateur Quarter Finals

1989 Northeast Amateur - Rhode Island 5th PLACE

1989 Golf World - Palmetto Dunes, S.C. 1st PLACE

1989 NCAA All American

1990 NCAA All American

1990 Northeast Amateur - Rhode Island 3rd PLACE

1990 Porter Cup - Niagara Falls Country Club 5th PLACE

1990 Pacific Coast Amateur - Eugene Country Club OR 2nd PLACE

1990 California State Open Low Amateur 3rd year 1st PLACE

1990 U.S. Amateur - Quarterfinalist

1990 Ranked 5th in the U.S. by Titleist and Golf Week Publications

1991 Finalist in the British Amateur

Bob May played on the 1991 Walker Cup team along with Phil Mickelson and David Duval, defeating the European team.

1999 British Masters Champion, also known for his Epic playoff with Tiger Woods at the PGA

Championship finishing 2nd three times on the PGA Tour, and 4 times on the Web.com Tour.
